intro: Cyathula alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is characterized by its alternate leaf arrangement and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Cyathula alternifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
